SEARCH
Module paths
Package ntnu.idatt2001.ejhaslerjorgfi.model

Class Player.Builder

java.lang.Object
ntnu.idatt2001.ejhaslerjorgfi.model.Player.Builder
Enclosing class:
Player
public static class Player.Builder extends Object

Builder

Represents an implementation of the creational design pattern known as the Builder. It is a static inner class of the Player class, and can therefore access the private fields and methods of its outer class.

The Builder provides a way to initialize a new instance of the Player class by setting each field value separately rather than providing all parameters to the constructor directly.

The Builder will return the valid Player object as long as the required fields are specified. In the case of the Player class, this only includes the Player.name field. Both Player.health, Player.score and Player.gold are assigned default values of 0, which are considered valid values for these fields. The Player.inventory field is by default an empty List, which is also considered valid.

Each mutator method of the Builder class returns the Builder object itself, making it possible to chain the method calls of the Builder as well as calling the different methods in seperate execution instructions.

Since:
27.03.2023
Version:
27.03.2023
Author:
Group 24

  • Constructor Details

    • Builder

      public Builder()
      Creates a new instance of the static inner Builder class.

      Declares a new instance of Player with field values yet to be assigned.

  • Method Details

    • build

      public Player build()
      Returns a complete instance of the Player class with its assigned field values.
      Returns:
      new Player object with the specified attributes.
      Throws:
      IncompletePlayerConstruction - if any of the required fields of the Player object is not specified.

    • setName

      public Player.Builder setName(String name)
      Sets the name of the Player to be constructed.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the Player.
      Returns:
      this Builder for chaining method calls.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - If the name has the value 'null'.
      BlankStringException - If the name is either an empty string or consist of only white spaces.

      Parameters:
      name - the name of the Player.
      Returns:
      this Builder for chaining method calls.
      Throws:

      Parameters:

      Returns:
      this Builder for chaining method calls.

      Parameters:

      Returns:
      this Builder for chaining method calls.

    • addInventory

      public Player.Builder addInventory(String item)
      Adds an item to the inventory of the Player to be constructed.
      Parameters:
      item - an item to add to the Player's inventory.
      Returns:
      this Builder for chaining method calls.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the item is null or a blank String.

    • addInventory

      public Player.Builder addInventory(List<String> items)
      Adds a collection of items to the inventory of the Player to be constructed.
      Parameters:
      items - a list of items to add to the Player's inventory.
      Returns:
      this Builder for chaining method calls.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if either of the items are null or a blank String.
      NullPointerException - if the list is null or empty.
